content.title: High-Output Heart Failure
content.description: Cardiac failure due to high-flow AV fistula

key_concepts.details: Chronic high cardiac output leads to ventricular dilation and eventual failure
Access flow >2 L/min, Qa/CO ratio >0.3, upper arm fistulas
Branham sign (heart rate decrease with fistula compression), echocardiogram
Flow reduction (banding, plication) or access ligation; heart failure management

content.clinical_significance: Underdiagnosed cause of heart failure in dialysis patients
content.statement: High-Output Heart Failure is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Dialysis-Access that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding High-Output Heart Failure helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of High-Output Heart Failure include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of High-Output Heart Failure.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). High-Output Heart Failure. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
